meanings.definition: To mint again; to produce new coins
meanings.sent1: The government is reminting old coins to make them shiny and new.
meanings.sent2: The mint is reminting the old currency to improve its quality.
meanings.sent3: After reminting the coins, they sparkled like stars in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Reminting the currency breathed new life into the economy.
meanings.sent5: The process of reminting brought a fresh gleam to the coins.

meanings.definition: To create anew; to refresh or renew
meanings.sent1: She enjoys reminting her wardrobe by adding colorful accessories.
meanings.sent2: The artist is reminting his masterpiece to enhance its beauty.
meanings.sent3: Reminting the old song with a modern twist made everyone dance.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like reminting a dull day into a bright one.
meanings.sent5: The rain reminted the garden, making it bloom with new life.

meanings.definition: To make new again; to restore to mint condition
meanings.sent1: The mechanic is reminting the classic car to its former glory.
meanings.sent2: Reminting the antique clock made it look brand new.
meanings.sent3: Reminting the old furniture gave the room a fresh look.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter was like reminting a faded memory back to life.
meanings.sent5: The restoration project involved reminting the historic building.
